:tada: Splice release `0.4.8` is ready for deployment on TestNet, and is available from the GSF
:ship: ⅔ of Super Validator nodes have upgraded to this release, including the GSF Super Validator node
*SV node status here*: <https://sync.global/sv-network>
*Release notes here*: <https://docs.test.sync.global/release_notes.html>

text: I initiated the request for whitelisting. Here are instructions for <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_onboarding.html#validating-that-your-ip-has-been-approved|how to verify>. It takes a little bit of time (up to 7 days) as  2/3rds of the SVs need to adopt that whitelist.

text:
Hi Tim,

I deliver the JAR to every node in our cluster and just mount it in with host path (similar to the CNI). so every node has a `/opt/canton/ an`

text: When using Slack Connect, many elements, like as visibility and settings, are controlled by the external organization’s Slack workspace. GSF adds participants via Slack Connect with "Post and Invite" enabled, but each organization’s Slack settings may override or limit what users can see or do.

elements.text: When using Slack Connect, many elements, like as visibility and settings, are controlled by the external organization’s Slack workspace. GSF adds participants via Slack Connect with "Post and Invite" enabled, but each organization’s Slack settings may override or limit what users can see or do.
Channel Overview

text: Hi <@U0821PFKM0V> does this notification mean that we are good to upgrade mainnet validators to 0.4.7?

elements.text: Hi
does this notification mean that we are good to upgrade mainnet validators to 0.4.7?

text:
Hi, we have a mainnet validator that is running a couple of versions behind, currently on 0.4.4.
Is it ok to upgrade to 0.4.7 directly, or are we supposed to go through the intermediate versions?

elements.text:
Hi, we have a mainnet validator that is running a couple of versions behind, currently on 0.4.4.
Is it ok to upgrade to 0.4.7 directly, or are we supposed to go through the intermediate versions?
GSF Operations made updates to a canvas tab:
Thanks, actually the chart allows for this out of the box:
What I am unsure of is how to add the driver to the java classpath for the JVM that's started by the canton binary.

text: A skip upgrade from 0.4.4 to 0.4.7 should work, though it has not been tested.

elements.text: A skip upgrade from 0.4.4 to 0.4.7 should work, though it has not been tested.

text: going through the intermediate versions is safer?

elements.text: going through the intermediate versions is safer?

text: <@U03HMUTQ5F0> We have built our own drivers for KMS, mounted them and would now like to test the external signing via KMS on DevNet but are struggling to figure out how to reference the driver. The only way I can see to make this work currently would be starting the java app manually without the binary, just wanted to get some insights here :pray:

elements.text: We have built our own drivers for KMS, mounted them and would now like to test the external signing via KMS on DevNet but are struggling to figure out how to reference the driver. The only way I can see to make this work currently would be starting the java app manually without the binary, just wanted to get some insights here

Did you follow the KMS Driver developer guide to build your KMS driver?

<https://docs.digitalasset.com/operate/3.3/tutorials/kms_driver_guide.html#kms-driver-guide>

text:
<@U03HMUTQ5F0> yes I have built a KMS Driver based on the developer guide, for now I am trying to get it to work as external signer for the participant for a newly created instance on DevNet. I have not looked into the external signing API, this seems like an interesting usecase, for now I would just like to test whether the driver works as expected based on the daml docs.

<@U03NCGBFCDP> this I have not tried yet, so far I was looking into the `CLASSPATH` environment variable which will not work as the canton binary specifies a `-classpath` in the startup already and this will repace anything set in the env if I am not mistaken. Was thinking if the `JAVA_OPTS`  can be leveraged here to append this somehow.

elements.text: yes I have built a KMS Driver based on the developer guide, for now I am trying to get it to work as external signer for the participant for a newly created instance on DevNet. I have not looked into the external signing API, this seems like an interesting usecase, for now I would just like to test whether the driver works as expected based on the daml docs.
this I have not tried yet, so far I was looking into the
CLASSPATH
environment variable which will not work as the canton binary specifies a
-classpath
in the startup already and this will repace anything set in the env if I am not mistaken. Was thinking if the
JAVA_OPTS
can be leveraged here to append this somehow.

text:
You could try `JAVA_OPTS`  but make sure to append to it because the canton script already sets values for it.
The reason I’m suggesting `EXTRA_CLASSPATH` is because it’s specifically added to the classpath here: <https://github.com/digital-asset/canton/blob/main/community/app/src/pack/bin/canton#L146>

elements.text: You could try

text: I'm currently planning to run a validator upgrade for the first time, it is on docker-compose and I just wanted to double check the plan looks good

elements.text: I'm currently planning to run a validator upgrade for the first time, it is on docker-compose and I just wanted to double check the plan looks good

text:
Docs says:
`Note that for docker-compose you must update the full bundle including the docker compose file and the start.sh script and adjust IMAGE_TAG. Only updating IMAGE_TAG is insufficient as the old docker compose files might be incompatible with the new version.`
The plan is:
1. Backup DBs
2. Stop the instance using stop.sh
3. Download the new splice bundle and unpack
4. Copy nginx config from the old splice install directory
5. Export the new version in the IMAGE_TAG env variable
6. Start using start.sh with the same params as before

elements.text: Docs says:

Note that for docker-compose you must update the full bundle including the docker compose file and the start.sh script and adjust IMAGE_TAG. Only updating IMAGE_TAG is insufficient as the old docker compose files might be incompatible with the new version.

The plan is:
1. Backup DBs
2. Stop the instance using stop.sh
3. Download the new splice bundle and unpack
4. Copy nginx config from the old splice install directory
5. Export the new version in the IMAGE_TAG env variable
6. Start using start.sh with the same params as before

text: don't forget to move `.env` from your old bundle as well

elements.text: don't forget to move
.env
from your old bundle as well

text: also regarding p 6. - start is going with empty `-o ""` flag, e.g. without onboarding secret

elements.text: also regarding p 6. - start is going with empty
flag, e.g. without onboarding secret

text: for 6 empty -o but do I still need to pass the party hint and other params or are they picked up from the existing volume/db?

elements.text: for 6 empty -o but do I still need to pass the party hint and other params or are they picked up from the existing volume/db?

text:
rest of the params stays the same as during launch.
in total you must put:
-s  with sponsor sv url
-o empty
-p same as during launch
-m same as well (double-check for changes <https://sync.global/sv-network/>)
-w stays, with no value
-a  no value, in case if you using oauth provider and have it configured in .env
